channel.id: The Fresh Prince OF Bel Air
channel.display-name: The Fresh Prince OF Bel Air

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham's guests include Hollywood actor Matt Damon, Downton Abbey's Hugh Bonneville and Bill Murray, who star in George Clooney's new Second World War movie The Monuments Men. Paloma Faith provides the music, performing her new single Can't Rely on You, and the host subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better be good

programme.title: Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman revisits the Cliffs from Leeds, three years following their relocation to Adelaide. After facing tough times in the UK, they reveal whether emigrating was the answer to their problems and if it brought them the new life they were hoping for

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a semi-detached house in south London, a corner-terrace in Blackpool and a three-bedroomed property in Northumberland. They then follow the sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The High Court enforcement officers try to get the compensation owed to a former office manager who won a tribunal after being sacked by text message. They also take on a company that has failed to pay an out-of-court settlement after selling a man a faulty boat, and receive a frosty reception at a garage that has not given a customer the money owed for selling a car on his behalf

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright meets the fraud investigators working on the case of a woman who illegally claimed Â£47,000 in benefits after claiming she was a single mother, and hears the story of a man who woke up one day to find he had lost his sight

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Henry Meadows and Jeremy Lamond help two teams search for valuable antiques at the Bath and West Showground near Shepton Mallet, Somerset. While there, they uncover a large pair of cattle horns and Dalton cauldrons that they hope will make a healthy profit at auction in Bristol. Tim Wonnacott also takes time out to visit designer William Morris's former country residence in the Cotswolds

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Kevin helps a man who has been wrongly accused of being a paedophile by a gang on his estate, and Daniel tries to convince Mrs Tembe to be Joe's godmother. Meanwhile, Al and Howard put an end to their conflict over Fliss. Medical drama, starring Simon Rivers

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win Â£1,000, but only by achieving absolute perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money rolls over to create a bigger jackpot in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a young family with a budget of Â£350,000 search for a home in rural North Yorkshire. The presenter also learns about the `Mouseman' - a legend in the world of hand-crafted furniture

programme.title: James Martin
programme.desc: The chef makes a beef and red wine pie, a chicken fricassee and home-made marshmallows in a chocolate winter sauce, all designed to provide warmth on a cold winter's night. Plus, he meets farmers producing high quality salt marsh beef and one of only three pure chocolate producers in the UK

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden and Christina Trevanion visit the Malvern Flea and Collectors Fair, and go head to head by purchasing items and then selling them at auction, aiming to make money for a chosen charity

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat is shocked by an unexpected visitor berating her for what she has done - although she is not the only resident of the Square surprised by the new arrival. Jane notices Ian is placing a lot of pressure on Bobby, leading to an argument between the former couple that is only made worse when Jane discovers the real reason her ex-husband invited her to stay. Linda feels inspired to help the market traders in their fight against the council and rallies the troops for a demonstration, while Masood realises Shabnam hasn't got over the separation

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zosia is excited when Sacha finally gives her the chance to prove herself with a challenging patient, only for events to take a catastrophic turn. Jonny is shocked when Jac suggests her position gives her the right to make decisions about their daughter. He resolves to expose her as a bully - but it proves harder than he imagined. Harry is frustrated by the return of adoring patient Annie and does his best to shake her off

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A birdwatcher is stabbed to death with his own knife, a case that holds a certain fascination for Humphrey, who was a keen twitcher in his youth. The victim was one of a group of enthusiasts who had visited the island for a glimpse of a famous parrot - but the team soon faces a conundrum as all the suspects were in full sight of one another when the crime was committed. As the cops search for answers, they uncover evidence of long-standing rivalries, secret jealousies and romantic entanglements. But would any of it justify killing a harmless ornithologist?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: New series. The work of Yorkshire's Regional Roads Crime Team, who are using headcams as a new tool to collect evidence. A drugs dealer is faced with a police search on camera and a first-time offender speeds away from the cops in his wife's car, so the officers take off in pursuit. A drunk-driver is rudely woken by the police in a hotel car park, leading to an unexpected find

programme.title: The Mexican (2001)
programme.desc: A petty crook finds himself in a tricky situation when he tries to smuggle an antique gun from Mexico into America for his Mob boss. As events begin to spiral out of control, his girlfriend's displeasure and a pursuing hitman only add to the would-be bootlegger's woes. Comedy thriller directed by Gore Verbinski, with Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, James Gandolfini, Gene Hackman and JK Simmons

programme.title: Film 2014
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman and Danny Leigh review the latest big-screen releases, including The Monuments Men, George Clooney's ensemble drama telling the story of an unlikely Second World War platoon given the task of retrieving works of art plundered by the Nazis. They also cast an eye over Nick Frost's salsa dance comedy Cuban Fury

programme.title: Russia on Four Wheels
programme.desc: Justin Rowlatt and Anita Rani conclude their separate road trips across Russia from Sochi. In St Petersburg, Anita encounters migrant workers and gay rights protesters before heading north to meet entrepreneurs harvesting caviar from sturgeon and ending her journey in Murmansk. Justin continues east into the Ural Mountains and Asia, spending time with bear hunters and visiting Russia's biggest arms fair

programme.title: Animal Odd Couples
programme.desc: Part one of two. It has long been believed that wildlife has evolved so that each different species sticks to its own kind. However, in recent years, the internet has been full of clips of unusual partnerships between animals, in which they display what appears to be friendship, affection and even love. Biologist Liz Bonnin sets out to discover whether science can explain such behaviour, asking why a cat would adopt some ducklings and whether an orang-utan could keep a dog as a pet

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: Young people from state schools take on the roles of barrister, defendant, witness and jury in a courtroom at the Old Bailey in London

programme.title: Ancient Egypt
programme.desc: Joann Fletcher examines the lives of ordinary Egyptian citizens 3,500 years ago

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: Part one of two. Art historian and curator Eleanor Nairne examines paintings such a LS Lowry's Britain at Play, Andy Warhol's Marilyn Diptych and Henri Rousseau's Surprised!. Plus, works by Paula Rego and Joseph Wright of Derby

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage on day 11 of the Games, featuring live alpine skiing, ice hockey, short track speed skating and Nordic Combined skiing. The alpine skiing at 6.45 at Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana is the opening event, as the first run in the women's giant slalom takes place, with the concluding second run at 11.15. The men's ice hockey at 8.00 is the focus of attention at the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi, with two teams taking to the ice in the first qualification play-off, and a place in the quarter-finals at stake. The short track speed skating gets under way at 9.30 at the Adler Arena across the Olympic Park with the women's 1,000m heats, followed by the men's 500m heats and culminating in the women's 3,000m relay finals at 11.00. The final coverage of the programme is from the RusSki Gorki Jumping Centre in Krasnaya Polyana from 12.00, where the medals are decided in the men's individual Large Hill cross-country 10km race

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents further coverage of day 11 of the Games in Russia, featuring live ice hockey and highlights from the speed skating and bobsleigh. The first action comes immediately from the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi, joining the second men's ice hockey qualification play-off 30 minutes after face-off, as the sides look to book a place in the quarter-finals. The top four-ranked teams from the group stage qualified for the last eight, with the nations ranked 5-12 having to play an extra fixture. Highlights of the men's 10,000m speed skating final at the Adler Arena in Sochi can be seen at 3.00, with action from the first run of the women's two-man bobsleigh to follow from 3.45 at the Sliding Centre Sanki in Krasnaya Polyana

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces the concluding coverage on day 11 in Russia, featuring live freestyle skiing, and action from the bobsleigh, curling and ice hockey. The opening focus is on a selection of sports across the Games, with the women's two-man bobsleigh taking place at the Sliding Centre Sanki in Krasnaya Polyana, the men's half-pipe freestyle skiing qualifiers at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park and any required play-off matches at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi. At 5.30 attention focuses fully on Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana as the medals are decided in the men's half-pipe freestyle skiing, with the first champion being crowned as the discipline makes its debut in the Games. The final action of the day comes from Sochi's Bolshoy Ice Dome and Shayba Arena, where the men's ice hockey qualification play-offs reach a conclusion. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day 11 in Russia, where five gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. Alpine skiing, freestyle skiing, short track speed skating, Nordic Combined skiing and speed skating were the sports that saw new champions crowned, while the bobsleigh, curling and ice hockey also continued. The alpine skiing is always a highlight of any Games, and today's focus at Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana was on the women's giant slalom. Viktoria Rebensburg claimed gold four years ago in Vancouver, as Germany excelled in the women's disciplines, with Slovenia's Tina Maze having to settle for a second silver of the Games, and Elizabeth Goergl of Austria taking bronze. Plus, a look ahead to tomorrow, which will see a further eight golds awarded

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: New series. The contest to find Britain's best amateur sewer returns, this time with 10 competitors trying to impress judges May Martin from the Women's Institute and Savile Row designer Patrick Grant. In the first set of challenges, they must make a simple tunic out of cotton, transform a plain high-street woollen skirt in just 90 minutes, and fit a model with a made-to-measure silk nightgown. Presented by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: How China Fooled the World - With Robert Peston
programme.desc: China has the second largest economy in the world and has been growing at an astonishing rate for the past 30 years. In a documentary for the This World strand, the BBC's new economics editor Robert Peston reveals that the vast majority of the enormous investments in industry and infrastructure has been built on credit, leaving huge debts and questions over how much of the money can ever be paid back. Featuring interviews with ex-US treasury secretary Henry `Hank' Paulson, former Financial Services Authority chairman Jonathan Adair Turner and banking analyst Charlene Chu

programme.title: House of Fools
programme.desc: A magazine offers a chimpanzee as a prize to anyone who can provide a genuine photo of a ghost, and Vic instantly begins a search of the flat with Beef and Bosh. He decides to perform a seance and successfully summons a spirit, but Bob is the only one who can see it. Guest starring Reece Shearsmith. Last in the series

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: As they contain no active ingredient, placebo medicines and pills should not really work, but they are now being shown to be effective in helping treat pain and depression and even alleviating some of the symptoms of Parkinson's disease. This programme explores why they work and how everyone could benefit from them

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Champions League Weekly
programme.desc: A look ahead to the last 16 of European football's elite competition, with first-leg matches including Manchester City v Barcelona at the Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Bayern Munich at the Emirates Stadium

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show USA
programme.desc: The host takes his successful talk show stateside, where he invites American guests to air their differences, and dispenses his own judgment on the situation

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice

programme.title: Daybreak
programme.desc: Morning show featuring news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Benidorm star Jake Canuso joins Kate Garraway to chat about the series to date, as every episode made so far is released on DVD in a bumper box set

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the fashion trends for the new season, all the stories making the newspaper headlines, viewers' comments in the Hub and a recipe in the kitchen. Presented by Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield. Including at 11.25 ITV News and Regional Weather

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Kaye Adams hosts the topical debate from a female perspective, with panellists including Janet Street-Porter, plus celebrity interviews

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: News

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team visit Nottingham, where antiques experts Mike Melody, James Layte and Karen Dalmeny haggle with the locals over their favourite items and a Victorian solitaire game makes a tidy sum

programme.title: The Alan Titchmarsh Show
programme.desc: The green-fingered host is joined by Holby City's John Michie, and Anton Du Beke performs in the studio with Summer Strallen as his Ballroom to Broadway tour continues. Plus, the latest pet news with the Barking Blondes

programme.title: ITV London Weather
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Quiz show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: At the clinic, the atmosphere between Val and Eric remains frosty as they take their HIV tests, before being called back in for their results. Bob confides in Dan that Brenda is the thief and finds a way to return some of the stolen items, but Dan soon passes the news on to Kerry. Bernice helps Nicola set up her fake online dating profile to trap Anton

programme.title: Live UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Manchester City v Barcelona (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the last-16 first leg at the Etihad Stadium, as the hosts welcome the Spanish champions for an eagerly awaited contest. This is the first time City have progressed past the group stage of the Champions League, and they would have hoped for an easier tie than this one. Much of their difficulty was due to them finishing second in their group behind Bayern Munich and therefore having to play a group winner, although they can take confidence from their outstanding home record and the suspicion that Barca are now slightly past their majestic peak. Presented by Adrian Chiles, with commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Andy Townsend, and analysis from Roy Keane, Lee Dixon and Roberto Martinez

programme.title: ITV News at Ten and Weather
programme.desc: News

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Highlights of the opening last-16 first-leg matches, featuring Bayer Leverkusen v Paris Saint-Germain at the BayArena and Manchester City v Barcelona at the Etihad Stadium. PSG are determined to become a major player in European competition after massive investment in recent years, and started as favourites to reach the quarter-finals against the Germans, who finished second to Manchester United in the group stage. Presented by Matt Smith, with commentary from Clive Tyldesley and Andy Townsend

programme.title: Jermain Defoe
programme.desc: A profile of the Tottenham Hotspur and England footballer who made his Premier League debut for West Ham United aged 18, and has also represented Portsmouth in the top flight. Throughout that time Defoe has had to overcome a series of personal tragedies, including the death of his half-brother in 2009 following an assault, as well as the loss of his father, who died while the striker was away on international duty preparing for Euro 2012 with the England squad. With contributions by Frank Lampard and Harry Redknapp

programme.title: The Mighty Mississippi with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: The second part of the broadcaster's journey begins in Clarksdale, Mississippi, where he meets Hollywood actor Morgan Freeman and discovers why he returned to his roots after 40 years away. In Memphis, Tennessee, the Rev Samuel Kyles shows the site where Martin Luther King was assassinated, and reveals that he was standing by the activist's side when he was shot. Trevor also meets 74-year-old Barbara Hearn, one of Elvis Presley's former girlfriends, who describes the singer at the beginning of his phenomenal rise to fame

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Random Acts
programme.desc: The short-form arts strand takes a hallucinatory trip inside an art gallery

programme.title: Scandal
programme.desc: Olivia protects a woman who runs an escort agency - but the progress of the case threatens to open a can of worms in the higher echelons of Washington, DC. Elsewhere, Quinn runs into trouble when she meets a reporter hanging around Amanda Tanner's hospital room. Kerry Washington and Katie Lowes star

programme.title: Hostages
programme.desc: Ellen's sister pays an unplanned visit, and Duncan insists that Lauren turns her away without making it look suspicious. The secret service calls Ellen in for further questioning, and with Duncan present at the session, she strives to remain calm. Thriller, starring Toni Collette, Dylan McDermott and Nina Arianda

programme.title: World Without End
programme.desc: Ralph persuades Queen Isabella to appoint him Earl of Shiring and he forces Philippa to agree to marry him - though she later evades his clutches with devastating consequences. Godwyn appears to have gone insane, but Petranilla succeeds in having him appointed Bishop of Kingsbridge and he immediately throws Caris out of the convent and sentences her to be burned as a witch. Convinced by Isabella that Kingsbridge is a hotbed of rebellion, Edward's army surrounds the town. Thomas rallies the townspeople, but is it too late? Last in the series

programme.title: Supernanny US
programme.desc: Jo Frost comes to the aid of stay-at-home mum Joey-Lynn George and her husband Glenn, who have five spirited daughters and a granddaughter living under the same roof in San Antonio, Texas. Exhausted by the arguments and aggressive behaviour of their brood, they have given up on any kind of discipline, leaving Jo with the tough task of helping them regain control

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit past house-hunters, beginning with globe-trotting Matt Rushworth, who was looking forward to settling down near his family in Windsor. They then catch up with Sheffield couple Justin and Deborah who were seeking a bigger home, but had very different opinions on how to tackle the property to make room for their sports gear

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Another contestant takes the hot seat, hoping to win big money by guessing which box contains Â£250,000 - while the mysterious banker tries to minimise his losses by offering a deal. Noel Edmonds presents

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Another contestant takes the hot seat, hoping to win big money by guessing which box contains Â£250,000 - while the mysterious banker tries to minimise his losses by offering a deal. Noel Edmonds presents

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Richard Arnold in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen is showered with gifts by her old sparring partner Scott, but her mind is elsewhere. Meanwhile, Grace tries to ignore the passing of another uneventful Valentine's Day, but ends up falling for a greetings-card writer. American comedy, guest starring Jeff Goldblum and Edward Burns with Debra Messing and Megan Mullally

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will accompanies Grace on her first date with Nick so that he can keep her in check. Meanwhile, Karen hatches an outrageous scheme to set Jack up with the neighbourhood bird enthusiast, but things do not go as planned. Guest starring Luke Perry

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank has some anecdotes published in a magazine, sowing the seeds of grand writing ambitions. He approaches Ray's editor about becoming a columnist, but finds his way with words leaves a lot to be desired. Comedy, starring Peter Boyle

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie decides 40 years of marriage to Frank is enough for any woman and moves in with Ray - to the delight of Robert, who enjoys being mothered by her. Debra is unhappy with the situation and tries to persuade her father-in-law to apologise, but he is enjoying the single life too much to agree

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra's snooty parents announce they are going to pay a visit - much to the dismay of Ray, who pleads with Frank and Marie to be on their best behaviour and avoid embarrassing him. Ray Romano stars

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne tries to avoid returning to England to visit her family, while Frasier is given a recording of his first radio broadcast in Seattle. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne's ex-fiance Clive visits Seattle to declare his undying love and ask her to marry him. Rather than saying she cannot see a future for them, she decides to let him down gently and pretends to be Niles's wife. With David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz talks Frasier into going on a blind date with one of her friends - but Bulldog ends up falling in love with her. Meanwhile, a spelling mistake in an advert causes trouble for Niles, and Daphne accidentally destroys Martin's favourite shoes. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Dan Butler

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels threatened by a 15-year-old physics prodigy who is even cleverer than he is, and asks Leonard to help him discredit the precocious teenager's research. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Raj and Howard kick Sheldon off their physics quiz team and replace him with Leslie Winkle, so he decides to prove his superiority by forming a rival quartet of his own. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: Channel 4 News Midday Summary

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Lisa Mulholland hosts the final dinner party in Galway, and tries not to let her nerves ruin her night, but an unimpressive starter does not help. She serves her dessert in fancy dress in a bid to achieve a better score, before the winner of the 1,000-euro prize is announced

programme.title: Deal or No Deal

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Anthony Street hosts the second day in Essex, and has his work cut out trying to impress the diners after displaying some unusual table manners the previous night. However, he hopes his passion for quirky entertainment will be enough to win them over

programme.title: Superstar Dogs
programme.desc: John Barrowman presents as dogs and their owners take part in a number of challenges, leading to a grand finale at the Dogstacle course. This episode, a Cockapoo, a Whippet-Staff cross and a Border Collie all compete for the chance to be crowned at this year's Crufts

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart and Lisa play an ill-advised cliff-top prank that leaves them convinced they have killed Martin. Meanwhile, Marge hires a TV crew to keep a constant watch over Homer so that she can be sure he is sticking to his diet

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Nancy is upset by Darren's inconsiderate actions. Phoebe wants to be optimistic for George and Vincent, but is unsure whether it will be plain sailing for the pair. Meanwhile, Freddie and Sinead could be forced to admit the truth, and Tegan welcomes the support of a friend as she comes to terms with being embarrassed by her family

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in south London to catch up with identical twins Matt and Chris Wickham, who were looking to buy a place together on a budget of Â£350,000. The property experts also revisit trainee solicitor Jemma Pollock, who was searching for her first home with a little help from her father. Last in the series

programme.title: The Taste
programme.desc: Chef Simon Rogan from L'Enclume in Cumbria, one of Britain's most critically acclaimed restaurants, shows the remaining contestants how one man's trash can be another man's treasure, as he challenges them to prepare food using leftovers. From fish heads to wine dregs, can they turn scraps into sensational spoonfuls and impress Nigella Lawson, Anthony Bourdain and Ludo Lefebvre?

programme.title: Sexting Teacher
programme.desc: Documentary telling the stories of three teacher-pupil relationships in the age of social media and smartphones, starting with a dramatic reconstruction of the most recent case to hit the headlines - maths teacher Jeremy Forrest, who ran away to France with a 15-year-old girl. All three cases in the programme led to the conviction of the adult and had a tumultuous effect on the lives of those involved

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr returns with the topical comedy panel show, joined by team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson with celebrity guests Paul Hollywood, Dawn O'Porter, Joe Wilkinson and Rob Beckett, to discuss and dissect the events that set the British public's chins wagging over the past week

programme.title: Paul Chowdhry
programme.desc: Stand-up show in which the comedian entertains an audience with his dry observational humour tapping into aspects of modern-day Britain. Inspired by Richard Pryor, George Carlin and Sam Kinison, the Stand Up for the Week host has established himself as one of the most popular funnymen to have emerged into the mainstream in recent years

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary observing the lives of staff at Princess Anne maternity hospital in Southampton, who - led by co-ordinator midwife Kay Duggan - help patients meet the challenges of becoming parents. In the first programme, two teenage sweethearts wait to meet their baby, and a woman who confesses to having a low pain threshold waits nervously with her husband

programme.title: Random Acts
programme.desc: The short-form arts strand takes a hallucinatory trip inside an art gallery

programme.title: Scandal
programme.desc: Olivia protects a woman who runs an escort agency - but the progress of the case threatens to open a can of worms in the higher echelons of Washington, DC. Elsewhere, Quinn runs into trouble when she meets a reporter hanging around Amanda Tanner's hospital room. Kerry Washington and Katie Lowes star

programme.title: Hostages
programme.desc: Ellen's sister pays an unplanned visit, and Duncan insists that Lauren turns her away without making it look suspicious. The secret service calls Ellen in for further questioning, and with Duncan present at the session, she strives to remain calm. Thriller, starring Toni Collette, Dylan McDermott and Nina Arianda

programme.title: World Without End
programme.desc: Ralph persuades Queen Isabella to appoint him Earl of Shiring and he forces Philippa to agree to marry him - though she later evades his clutches with devastating consequences. Godwyn appears to have gone insane, but Petranilla succeeds in having him appointed Bishop of Kingsbridge and he immediately throws Caris out of the convent and sentences her to be burned as a witch. Convinced by Isabella that Kingsbridge is a hotbed of rebellion, Edward's army surrounds the town. Thomas rallies the townspeople, but is it too late? Last in the series

programme.title: Supernanny US
programme.desc: Jo Frost comes to the aid of stay-at-home mum Joey-Lynn George and her husband Glenn, who have five spirited daughters and a granddaughter living under the same roof in San Antonio, Texas. Exhausted by the arguments and aggressive behaviour of their brood, they have given up on any kind of discipline, leaving Jo with the tough task of helping them regain control

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit past house-hunters, beginning with globe-trotting Matt Rushworth, who was looking forward to settling down near his family in Windsor. They then catch up with Sheffield couple Justin and Deborah who were seeking a bigger home, but had very different opinions on how to tackle the property to make room for their sports gear

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit past house-hunters, beginning with globe-trotting Matt Rushworth, who was looking forward to settling down near his family in Windsor. They then catch up with Sheffield couple Justin and Deborah who were seeking a bigger home, but had very different opinions on how to tackle the property to make room for their sports gear

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Another contestant takes the hot seat, hoping to win big money by guessing which box contains Â£250,000 - while the mysterious banker tries to minimise his losses by offering a deal. Noel Edmonds presents

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Richard Arnold in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen is showered with gifts by her old sparring partner Scott, but her mind is elsewhere. Meanwhile, Grace tries to ignore the passing of another uneventful Valentine's Day, but ends up falling for a greetings-card writer. American comedy, guest starring Jeff Goldblum and Edward Burns with Debra Messing and Megan Mullally

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will accompanies Grace on her first date with Nick so that he can keep her in check. Meanwhile, Karen hatches an outrageous scheme to set Jack up with the neighbourhood bird enthusiast, but things do not go as planned. Guest starring Luke Perry

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank has some anecdotes published in a magazine, sowing the seeds of grand writing ambitions. He approaches Ray's editor about becoming a columnist, but finds his way with words leaves a lot to be desired. Comedy, starring Peter Boyle

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie decides 40 years of marriage to Frank is enough for any woman and moves in with Ray - to the delight of Robert, who enjoys being mothered by her. Debra is unhappy with the situation and tries to persuade her father-in-law to apologise, but he is enjoying the single life too much to agree

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra's snooty parents announce they are going to pay a visit - much to the dismay of Ray, who pleads with Frank and Marie to be on their best behaviour and avoid embarrassing him. Ray Romano stars

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne tries to avoid returning to England to visit her family, while Frasier is given a recording of his first radio broadcast in Seattle. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne's ex-fiance Clive visits Seattle to declare his undying love and ask her to marry him. Rather than saying she cannot see a future for them, she decides to let him down gently and pretends to be Niles's wife. With David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz talks Frasier into going on a blind date with one of her friends - but Bulldog ends up falling in love with her. Meanwhile, a spelling mistake in an advert causes trouble for Niles, and Daphne accidentally destroys Martin's favourite shoes. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Dan Butler

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels threatened by a 15-year-old physics prodigy who is even cleverer than he is, and asks Leonard to help him discredit the precocious teenager's research. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Mr Elf demonstrates why it takes so long to make flour, but Nanny Plum refuses to wait, and uses magic to speed up the elf windmill

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Fussy visits Miss Magic's shop to search for the perfect hat, and Mr Stubborn tries to drive while wearing an oversized bonnet

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Duck and Thomas take Harold the helicopter to Sodor Search and Rescue Centre when he breaks down near Callan Castle

programme.title: Noddy in Toyland
programme.desc: Sly and Gobbo clone themselves - and with twice the number of goblins around town, chaos ensues

programme.title: Fifi and the Flowertots
programme.desc: Slugsy invites Primrose to supper but she decides not to go because he has an unpleasant smell

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Snow ruins Peppa's trip to the beach with her friends and family

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig takes Peppa and George to a fish pond that he used to visit when he was a piglet

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig shows Peppa and her friend Suzy Sheep some old photographs from when they were babies

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig gives Grandma and Grandpa her old computer - but they have trouble working out how to use it

programme.title: Toby's Travelling Circus
programme.desc: When everyone has different ideas for a new act for the show, Toby decides to combine them all and comes up with something really spectacular

programme.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
programme.desc: Bernard invites everyone in Cuddlestown to a party, making the bananas think it must be his birthday

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Tickety Town is covered in fallen leaves, so the twins decide to try out McCoggins' new street sweeper. However, they disobey his instructions and press the turbo button

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The unit is called to the heart of the Essex countryside to help rescue a man pinned beneath a tractor, and the air support crew is sent out at night to hunt down a car thief in Southend. Meanwhile, the interceptors pursue a rogue driver around the back alleys of north-east London

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Trauma Doctors
programme.desc: A 22-year-old who has fallen three storeys is carefully manoeuvred out of a tight space and rushed to the Royal London Hospital, while the air ambulance team races to stabilise an elderly man who has been hit by a lorry. Elsewhere, a woman with a family history of aneurysms is experiencing dizziness, but a series of diagnostic tests only deepens the mystery, and paramedics are called out to King's Cross station to deal with a cardiac arrest

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Fed up with unwanted advice, Ricky calls a family meeting to declare she will make her own decision about the baby. Ms Montgomery goes on the offensive after Bianca's complaint, while Tamara tries to think of a way to help integrate the Summer Bay and Mangrove River students. Chris is nervous about his first day at work

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Disaster strikes on the camping trip when Mason goads Josh into having a go at abseiling. Back on Ramsay Street, Callum finds his way back into Josie's good books when he buys her a puppy, while Sonya tells Jacob to leave Erinsborough - but still manages to hurt Toadie's feelings

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Marine major is found dead in an underground maintenance room, having scratched out one of his own eyes - and the presence of a webcam suggests someone watched him die. The team investigates with the help of the US Army's Lt Col Hollis Mann, and links the case to wanted terrorist Mamoun Sharif, an old adversary who is threatening to unleash a chemical attack

programme.title: Still Life
programme.desc: Premiere. A resident of a rural Quebec village is found dead in the woods, but locals dismiss the death as a hunting accident. However, a police inspector is not convinced and unearths dark secrets in the community in his efforts to uncover the truth. Whodunnit based on Louise Penny's novel, starring Nathaniel Parker and Mylene Dinh-Robic. Edited for violence

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Disaster strikes on the camping trip when Mason goads Josh into having a go at abseiling. Back on Ramsay Street, Callum finds his way back into Josie's good books when he buys her a puppy, while Sonya tells Jacob to leave Erinsborough - but still manages to hurt Toadie's feelings

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Fed up with unwanted advice, Ricky calls a family meeting to declare she will make her own decision about the baby. Ms Montgomery goes on the offensive after Bianca's complaint, while Tamara tries to think of a way to help integrate the Summer Bay and Mangrove River students. Chris is nervous about his first day at work

programme.title: The Big British Immigration Row
programme.desc: Highlights from Monday's studio debate exploring the emotive and controversial topic of immigration, examining how it is affecting the United Kingdom and its citizens. Subjects covered include national identity and racial and cultural integration, with contributions by MPs, decision-makers, opinion-formers and immigrants themselves

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers
programme.desc: In south Wales, inspectors Keith Hogben and Gemma Cooper follow up a report of two dogs being kept in appalling conditions and discover seven puppies are also loose in the house and adding to the mess. On a hot summer's day in Birmingham, Scott Vanes deals with a canine that has been locked in a small conservatory, while Herchy Boal visits a family having trouble letting go of an old dog with health problems

programme.title: Police 5
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Kate McIntyre offer advice on crime prevention, using hidden-camera stunts to reveal the tricks of the thieves' trade, and also accompanying police on raids and talking to amateur detectives and have-a-go heroes who fought back in the name of justice. Plus, Shaw Taylor tries to reunite theft victims with what is rightfully theirs, and there are appeals for information on the nation's most wanted criminals

programme.title: Benidorm ER
programme.desc: The documentary returns after a mid-series break. Tests reveal a heart attack after a 48-year-old from Glasgow is rushed in with chest pains, while Dr Torres treats a West Midlands woman struggling for breath and thinks the situation is serious enough for her to be admitted to hospital. A severely visually impaired man from Aberdeen explains what it is like to receive medical attention for a suspected broken arm from people he cannot see and in a language he does not understand, while a Norwegian visitor arrives at the ER with a gash on her wrist caused by the shattering of a glass shower door

programme.title: Holiday Love Rats Exposed
programme.desc: Documentary telling the stories of Brits who have been conned out of tens of thousands of pounds and left broken-hearted by people preying on single holiday-makers looking for love. Jeannette was swept off her feet by Rudiger in Sorrento, Italy, and over the next nine months spent Â£20,000 on him, only to discover he was wanted in several countries for duping women. Jane met Nigerian Michael in a Gambian nightclub and during their brief marriage gave him so much money she ended up bankrupt - unaware he was already in a long-term relationship

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called in when a woman is admitted to hospital after being found in a distressed state on a bus, claiming to have been raped. She tells the detectives it is the fourth time she has been assaulted by the same man over the past 15 years, but runs off before they get to ask any more questions. Crime drama, guest starring Jennifer Love Hewitt

programme.title: Body of Proof
programme.desc: Ethan is conducting a post-mortem examination when he has to step out of the room for a minute and returns to find the body has gone. The supposedly dead man is found wandering the offices still very much alive and claiming he was shot by his room-mate - who is later found dead in the back of a bin wagon. Megan's investigation leads her to a shocking cover-up at local government level

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: The murder of a cigar-maker leads to some surprising facts being uncovered about the victim. The team's enquiries turn up a surprising connection to Cuba, Fidel Castro and a hidden, bloody past. Elsewhere, Tim and Calleigh are convinced a woman is guilty of killing a man next to a cash machine - but struggle to find enough evidence to prove it

programme.title: Car Crime UK
programme.desc: Documentary showing how CCTV and other technological advances are helping to bring car thieves to justice. Suspected criminals in Chester are involved in a high-speed chase through the city centre, and there is footage that helped put an end to one of London's most prolific gangs. The programme also includes film of a getaway in which robbers tried to evade the law by driving at 180mph

programme.desc: Bazza cheats in the Bumpton pie contest and wins a trip for two to the town's finest hotel, but is not sure who to take with him

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The young royal resolves to win the palace treasure hunt

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Mr Elf demonstrates why it takes so long to make flour, but Nanny Plum refuses to wait, and uses magic to speed up the elf windmill

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Fussy visits Miss Magic's shop to search for the perfect hat, and Mr Stubborn tries to drive while wearing an oversized bonnet

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Duck and Thomas take Harold the helicopter to Sodor Search and Rescue Centre when he breaks down near Callan Castle

programme.title: Noddy in Toyland
programme.desc: Sly and Gobbo clone themselves - and with twice the number of goblins around town, chaos ensues

programme.title: Fifi and the Flowertots
programme.desc: Slugsy invites Primrose to supper but she decides not to go because he has an unpleasant smell

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Snow ruins Peppa's trip to the beach with her friends and family

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig takes Peppa and George to a fish pond that he used to visit when he was a piglet

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig shows Peppa and her friend Suzy Sheep some old photographs from when they were babies

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig gives Grandma and Grandpa her old computer - but they have trouble working out how to use it

programme.title: Toby's Travelling Circus
programme.desc: When everyone has different ideas for a new act for the show, Toby decides to combine them all and comes up with something really spectacular

programme.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
programme.desc: Bernard invites everyone in Cuddlestown to a party, making the bananas think it must be his birthday

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Tickety Town is covered in fallen leaves, so the twins decide to try out McCoggins' new street sweeper. However, they disobey his instructions and press the turbo button

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The unit is called to the heart of the Essex countryside to help rescue a man pinned beneath a tractor, and the air support crew is sent out at night to hunt down a car thief in Southend. Meanwhile, the interceptors pursue a rogue driver around the back alleys of north-east London

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Trauma Doctors
programme.desc: A 22-year-old who has fallen three storeys is carefully manoeuvred out of a tight space and rushed to the Royal London Hospital, while the air ambulance team races to stabilise an elderly man who has been hit by a lorry. Elsewhere, a woman with a family history of aneurysms is experiencing dizziness, but a series of diagnostic tests only deepens the mystery, and paramedics are called out to King's Cross station to deal with a cardiac arrest

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Fed up with unwanted advice, Ricky calls a family meeting to declare she will make her own decision about the baby. Ms Montgomery goes on the offensive after Bianca's complaint, while Tamara tries to think of a way to help integrate the Summer Bay and Mangrove River students. Chris is nervous about his first day at work

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Disaster strikes on the camping trip when Mason goads Josh into having a go at abseiling. Back on Ramsay Street, Callum finds his way back into Josie's good books when he buys her a puppy, while Sonya tells Jacob to leave Erinsborough - but still manages to hurt Toadie's feelings

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Marine major is found dead in an underground maintenance room, having scratched out one of his own eyes - and the presence of a webcam suggests someone watched him die. The team investigates with the help of the US Army's Lt Col Hollis Mann, and links the case to wanted terrorist Mamoun Sharif, an old adversary who is threatening to unleash a chemical attack

programme.title: Still Life
programme.desc: Premiere. A resident of a rural Quebec village is found dead in the woods, but locals dismiss the death as a hunting accident. However, a police inspector is not convinced and unearths dark secrets in the community in his efforts to uncover the truth. Whodunnit based on Louise Penny's novel, starring Nathaniel Parker and Mylene Dinh-Robic. Edited for violence

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Disaster strikes on the camping trip when Mason goads Josh into having a go at abseiling. Back on Ramsay Street, Callum finds his way back into Josie's good books when he buys her a puppy, while Sonya tells Jacob to leave Erinsborough - but still manages to hurt Toadie's feelings

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Fed up with unwanted advice, Ricky calls a family meeting to declare she will make her own decision about the baby. Ms Montgomery goes on the offensive after Bianca's complaint, while Tamara tries to think of a way to help integrate the Summer Bay and Mangrove River students. Chris is nervous about his first day at work

programme.title: The Big British Immigration Row
programme.desc: Highlights from Monday's studio debate exploring the emotive and controversial topic of immigration, examining how it is affecting the United Kingdom and its citizens. Subjects covered include national identity and racial and cultural integration, with contributions by MPs, decision-makers, opinion-formers and immigrants themselves

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers
programme.desc: In south Wales, inspectors Keith Hogben and Gemma Cooper follow up a report of two dogs being kept in appalling conditions and discover seven puppies are also loose in the house and adding to the mess. On a hot summer's day in Birmingham, Scott Vanes deals with a canine that has been locked in a small conservatory, while Herchy Boal visits a family having trouble letting go of an old dog with health problems

programme.title: Police 5
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Kate McIntyre offer advice on crime prevention, using hidden-camera stunts to reveal the tricks of the thieves' trade, and also accompanying police on raids and talking to amateur detectives and have-a-go heroes who fought back in the name of justice. Plus, Shaw Taylor tries to reunite theft victims with what is rightfully theirs, and there are appeals for information on the nation's most wanted criminals

programme.title: Benidorm ER
programme.desc: The documentary returns after a mid-series break. Tests reveal a heart attack after a 48-year-old from Glasgow is rushed in with chest pains, while Dr Torres treats a West Midlands woman struggling for breath and thinks the situation is serious enough for her to be admitted to hospital. A severely visually impaired man from Aberdeen explains what it is like to receive medical attention for a suspected broken arm from people he cannot see and in a language he does not understand, while a Norwegian visitor arrives at the ER with a gash on her wrist caused by the shattering of a glass shower door

programme.title: Holiday Love Rats Exposed
programme.desc: Documentary telling the stories of Brits who have been conned out of tens of thousands of pounds and left broken-hearted by people preying on single holiday-makers looking for love. Jeannette was swept off her feet by Rudiger in Sorrento, Italy, and over the next nine months spent Â£20,000 on him, only to discover he was wanted in several countries for duping women. Jane met Nigerian Michael in a Gambian nightclub and during their brief marriage gave him so much money she ended up bankrupt - unaware he was already in a long-term relationship

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called in when a woman is admitted to hospital after being found in a distressed state on a bus, claiming to have been raped. She tells the detectives it is the fourth time she has been assaulted by the same man over the past 15 years, but runs off before they get to ask any more questions. Crime drama, guest starring Jennifer Love Hewitt

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by panellists Sean Lock, Jimmy Carr, Marcus Brigstocke and Alan Davies to discuss fakes and frauds. The guests must answer questions on counterfeiters, with points awarded for the responses the host finds most interesting

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference. Guests Robert Webb, Phill Jupitus, Ronni Ancona and regular panellist Alan Davies answer questions on the topics of hypnosis, hallucinations and hysteria

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell is joined by MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and actor Nigel Havers, while Lee Mack teams up with writer and comedian Charlie Brooker and actress Nina Wadia, as the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon continues

programme.title: Russell Howard's Good News
programme.desc: The comedian offers his perspective on stories dominating the media, whether TV, online or print, as well as picking up on overlooked items that raise a smile. He is joined by a mystery guest who has featured in the news, while members of the audience are invited on to the People's Podium, and the show ends with a heart-warming tale

programme.title: Matt and Allegra's Big Farm
programme.desc: Matt Dawson and Allegra McEvedy visit a farm in Cumbria to look at where food comes from, and source ingredients for the ultimate feast

programme.title: Matt and Allegra's Big Farm
programme.desc: Matt Dawson and Allegra McEvedy visit the Vale of Evesham, Worcestershire, to look at where food comes from, and source ingredients for an ultimate feast. This time, lamb chops are on the menu

programme.title: Matt and Allegra's Big Farm
programme.desc: Matt Dawson and Allegra McEvedy visit Kent to look at the production of beef, and make a hearty casserole

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test-drive an Aston Martin DBS Convertible, a Ferrari California and a Lamborghini Gallardo Convertible through Romania, searching for the mountain highway built during the reign of the country's former dictator Nicolae Ceausescu - allegedly the best road to drive on in the world. Actor Eric Bana is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters try to impress Oxford residents by building an electric car, and refuse to let an unenthusiastic response deter them from sitting in on the machine's crash-test before handing it over to the Stig's environmentally friendly cousin. Actor Michael Sheen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and Jeremy Clarkson pits the Corvette ZR1 against the Audi R8 V10

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond debate which company has made the greatest number of exceptional vehicles, and James May finds a way of transporting caravans to campsites without inconveniencing other road users. The Top Gear track plays host to a replica of one of the world's most famous rally cars, and broadcaster Chris Evans is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The hosts bid to prove that cars can be art by filling a gallery in Middlesbrough with motoring-related works, including a few creations of their own. They also resort to unusual promotional techniques to attract more visitors to their exhibition. Back on the track, Jeremy Clarkson tests British supercar the Noble M600. Jenson Button drives the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Flip Men
programme.desc: New series. Doug and Mike buy a crystal meth laboratory, and have to contend with drug users, dealers and police while trying to complete their project

programme.title: Flip Men
programme.desc: Doug and Mike are met with a grisly scene at their new project and have to call the police

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The gang bids for bike parts, and a unit containing a body bag leaves everyone intrigued

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: T-Money dreams of money when he bids on a huge, chained-up container

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests David Mitchell, Rob Brydon, Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. The host asks questions on the topic of history, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Comedy quiz show from 2006, hosted by Dara O Briain, with guests Clive Anderson, Andy Parsons, Gina Yashere and Russell Howard and panellists Hugh Dennis and Frankie Boyle

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Jo Brand, Ed Byrne, Andy Parsons and Robin Ince join host Dara O Briain for a 2006 edition of the comedy quiz show, alongside panellists Hugh Dennis and Frankie Boyle

programme.title: Never Mind the Buzzcocks
programme.desc: John Barrowman hosts a festive edition of the comedy music quiz, as regular team captains Noel Fielding and Phill Jupitus are joined by singer Jason Derulo, comedians Joe Wilkinson and Jason Manford, plus television presenter Helen Skelton

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Francine's adoptive parents visit for an unannounced holiday with the family, and Stan becomes angry when they refuse to fall in with his `man of the house' attitude. Steve tries to impress a girl at school by living to the extreme

programme.title: Uncle
programme.desc: An infamous music producer misleads Andy into thinking Rage Records wishes to sign him and Errol, which in fact only the youngster is wanted. Later, a series of unfortunate events throws the custody case into jeopardy. Comedy, starring Nick Helm and Elliot Speller-Gillott. Last in the series

programme.title: Is Amanda Knox Guilty?
programme.desc: Having last month been found guilty for a second time by an Italian court for the murder of British student Meredith Kercher, Amanda Knox - who now resides in her native US - faces the prospect of extradition to serve a 28-year sentence. This documentary charts the evolution of the case - from Knox's original conviction and four years in prison, to her successful appeal in 2011 - and outlines the evidence that supports and contradicts her claims of innocence

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Russell Kane hosts the comedy show featuring an ensemble of up-and-coming talent, blending stand-up routines, short films, sketches and music. In his latest serving he explains why the British like to be unhappy, and Totally Tom become tour guides. Linda the Make-Up Girl inflicts some unconventional beauty treatments on Marcel Lucont

programme.title: Growing Up Down's
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of young actors with Down's syndrome as its members set out on tour with a production of Shakespeare's Hamlet. The programme also charts events taking place in their lives - including romance, rows and revelations

programme.title: Uncle
programme.desc: An infamous music producer misleads Andy into thinking Rage Records wishes to sign him and Errol, which in fact only the youngster is wanted. Later, a series of unfortunate events throws the custody case into jeopardy. Comedy, starring Nick Helm and Elliot Speller-Gillott. Last in the series

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Tough Young Teachers
programme.desc: The trainees approach the end of their first academic year, and must decide whether to stay in the teaching profession. Second-year student Chloe faces the dilemma of whether to pursue her ambition to travel, while Nick contemplates leaving Harefield Academy to be closer to his wife-to-be. Meanwhile, the teachers discover if they have made an impact on their students when the exam results are released. Last in the series

programme.title: Sun, Sex and Suspicious Parents
programme.desc: Twenty-somethings Agi and Billy embark on their first unsupervised holiday to the Thai island of Koh Samui, unaware their parents are covertly monitoring them. Agi's family does not drink and are surprised to see her partying, while Billy's mother know nothing of his wild social life and his holiday antics cause her some embarrassment

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: The Abbey Grove School election gets under way, and Alfie makes it his mission to prove Miss Gulliver wrong after she implies that none of his class members is suitable. Meanwhile, Fraser is suspended following an unfortunate incident involving a provocative internet viral. Starring Jack Whitehall, Sarah Solemani and Mathew Horne. Last in the series

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat is shocked by an unexpected visitor berating her for what she has done - although she is not the only resident of the Square surprised by the new arrival. Jane notices Ian is placing a lot of pressure on Bobby, leading to an argument between the former couple that is only made worse when Jane discovers the real reason her ex-husband invited her to stay. Linda feels inspired to help the market traders in their fight against the council and rallies the troops for a demonstration, while Masood realises Shabnam hasn't got over the separation

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Angry and resentful at being left behind while his parents set sail on a luxury cruise, Stewie arms himself with a machine gun and gives chase in a speedboat, intent on murdering Lois

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Joe leads a manhunt around Quahog, Lois returns to identify her would-be killer. Meanwhile, hell-bent on domination, Stewie takes extreme action to claim the title of supreme ruler of the world

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan uses CIA brainwashing techniques to stop Hayley leaving for France, but realises he will face deadly consequences unless he relinquishes his power over her. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger become private detectives

programme.title: The Life of Rock with Brian Pern
programme.desc: The host profiles a selection of rock stars who, like himself, applied their creative energies to acting, charity singles and protest songs. Plus, former Top of the Pops presenter Noel Edmonds reveals how Russians tried to take down the aircraft carrying Phil Collins from Wembley to Philadelphia during Live Aid in 1985. Spoof rock documentary, starring Simon Day

programme.title: Sounds of the 70s 2 Reggae - Stir It Up
programme.desc: Collection of archive performances by artists including Bob Marley & the Wailers, Susan Cadogan, the Specials, Ken Boothe, Steel Pulse, Dave & Ansell Collins, Althea & Donna and Janet Kay. Reggae was imported to the UK by immigrants from the West Indies, and became an established chart presence in the 1970s

programme.title: Amazon Abyss
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike deGruy and Kate Humble chart the depths of the river system in search of the unusual creatures that live there. The bottom of the Amazon remains largely unexplored, and a team of divers employs powerful underwater lights and high-definition cameras to seek out its inhabitants. However, the expedition holds many dangers - strong currents, waters thick with sediment and predators including anacondas, caimans and piranhas. Among the species featured is the knifefish, which navigates in the darkness by electrical impulses, and the giant jau, which is regarded with fear by the local people. First shown in 2005

programme.title: The Story of Top of the Pops 1979
programme.desc: A look back at a heady year for the chart show, which recorded its highest audience of 19 million viewers, as physical format singles peaked at four times that number. Social problems in Britain during the Winter of Discontent did not stop inventive musicians from making hay as eager fans queued up to embrace their output, and new wave, 2-tone, reggae, rock, folk and electro hits competed for the top slots. Among the featured artists are Gary Numan, Nile Rodgers, Jah Wobble and Woody from Madness

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: Reel History of Britain
programme.desc: Melvyn Bragg takes his vintage mobile cinema to Soho to look back to the 1950s, the decade that gave birth to the teenager. Singer Marty Wilde explains how the new music scene brightened up post-war Britain, and former `wild man of rock' Wee Willie Harris reminisces about the rowdy youths who dominated the dance floors

programme.title: Weird Nature
programme.desc: Exploring incredible creatures capable of amazing feats using just their bodies, beginning with a look at the common pearl caterpillar that can roll itself into a ball and wheel along at speed, and bushbabies that bounce along like rubber balls

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: New series. Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how having a skeleton has helped vertebrates to colonise and dominate almost every habitat on Earth. He begins his journey by looking at the influence of bones on size, revealing how they are capable of supporting large animals, with the strongest bone able to withstand 109 tons of pressure

programme.title: Dissected
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary in which a team of anatomy experts, led by Dr George McGavin, dissects a real human hand - and uncovers why it is unique in the animal kingdom. They find out how hands provide power and precision, and talk to individuals who use theirs in unique ways, including magicians and rock climbers

programme.title: Blink
programme.desc: Kevin Fong looks back through 40 years of Horizon archives to explore what science has revealed about methods of perception. He discovers why babies use touch more than any other sense, how vision can easily be tricked, and the ways technological advancements are getting closer to being able to replace human faculties if they fail

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Examining the heartland of the country, home to ancient structures such as the Great Wall and modern buildings like Beijing's Olympic Stadium, as well as animals including the giant panda and golden snub-nosed monkey. However, the region holds even deeper cultural significance as the land of origin of China's most populous ethnic group the Han people - whose 5,000-year-old traditions are increasingly under threat

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane presents a selection of popular online videos on the theme of dumb and dangerous, featuring unwitting contributors to their own downfall and others who have hit the self-destruct button deliberately in the name of internet glory. The line-up includes Man v Cactus, Woman v Water and Girl v Bus Stop, plus a humorous hair tutorial

programme.title: Revenge
programme.desc: Conrad hires a publicist to improve the family's image, and threatens Victoria with Patrick's safety to get her to co-operate with his plans. PR guru and former party girl Bizzy Preston also encourages Emily and Daniel to enter the spotlight - but Nolan has encountered her before and is wary of her motivations

programme.title: Marvel's Agents of SHIELD
programme.desc: With dangerous secrets being kept from the team, Coulson works the system to save Ward and Fitz when they are sent on a classified mission that could end in tragedy. Comic-book drama co-created by Joss Whedon, guest starring Maximiliano Hernandez (Thor) as Agent Sitwell

programme.title: The Ricky Gervais Show
programme.desc: Karl Pilkington pitches an idea for a movie in which an out-of-work actor called Brian takes over the body of the dead Tom Cruise to finish Mission: Impossible 8. Animated comedy from the creators of The Office and Extras that uses the original recordings from the comedian's record-breaking podcasts

programme.title: Glee
programme.desc: An untimely death proves a shock for Sue, while New Directions prepare for the national competition in New York with help from Jesse St James

programme.title: Ugly Betty
programme.desc: Afraid they might have unwittingly leaked vital information to a rival magazine, Marc, Amanda and Betty forge an uneasy alliance to ensure their guilty secret stays under wraps. Meanwhile, Daniel and Wilhelmina are forced to work together as a major deadline looms

programme.title: Switched
programme.desc: Aspiring rock star Pat revisits ballerina Becky and her family in North Carolina, a year after they swapped lives. A relationship blossoms between the pair, culminating in a kiss after Pat's performance on stage in Chicago

Dixon and Silver's relationship takes a surprising turn, and Adrianna reveals her secret to Naomi and Navid. Annie and Ethan set off on a visit to Palm Springs, and Tabitha's grandchildren receive an unexpected gift from her

programme.title: Ugly Betty
programme.desc: Daniel visits his mother in rehab, while Betty spends a hectic Halloween trying to track down her boss's missing watch and dealing with her growing attraction to Henry. Meanwhile, Wilhelmina is horrified to learn that she cannot fit into a designer gown

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gideon teleports Leo and Chris to an evil dimension, where everything is a mirror image of the normal world. Phoebe and Paige are sent to find them, facing a race against time as Piper prepares to give birth. Holly Marie Combs, Alyssa Milano, Brian Krause and Drew Fuller star

programme.title: Glee
programme.desc: The students head to New York to compete against rival choirs in the Nationals, and the pressure is on for them to organise their songs in time for the big day. Meanwhile, Will tries to keep his decision to leave McKinley High a secret, and Finn makes an effort to win Rachel back. Guest starring Patti LuPone

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos, including Darth Vader on a unicycle, a hamster that can act and a clip featuring Tron Guy

programme.desc: Jennifer and Audrey practice their matchmaking skills, but end up without dates themselves, while Russell falls in love with a woman he glimpses at Adam and Jeff's office. Comedy, starring David Spade, Patrick Warburton and Oliver Hudson

Freddie is enraged when it seems Lindsey is looking for love once again, and Dodger's search for his missing niece becomes increasingly desperate

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Marshall worries his past indiscretions will cost him his dream job, and Ted is unsure about who to bring to the Architects' Ball. Comedy, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted tries to apologise to an ex-girlfriend for being unfaithful, while Marshall and Lily make a bet with Barney that could force him to wear a tie with a duck pattern on it. Comedy, starring Josh Radnor and Jason Segel

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard returns from his space mission, but the welcome from his friends and family does not meet his expectations. His night alone with Bernadette goes badly, his mother ignores him, and he realises Stuart has taken his place as Raj's best friend. On top of that, Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny kick him out of their group game night. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Stuart hosts a Halloween party at the comic-book store, and Howard talks incessantly about his work on board the International Space Station, annoying his wife and friends. Penny and Leonard have a steamy encounter at the lab. Guest starring real-life astronaut Buzz Aldrin
